title: Duchess of Cambridge wears traditional style outfit as Duke says Pakistan can rely on the UK 'as a key partner and friend'
text:
The Duchess of Cambridge arrived in Pakistan with a nod to both her hosts and the memory of her mother-in-law, wearing a traditional shalwar-kameez style outfit from one of Princess Diana's favourite couture houses.

The royal couple landed amid tight security at an airbase outside Islamabad to start a five-day visit to showcase the Commonwealth's second most populous nation and strengthen ties with Britain.

The Duchess stepped down from their RAF Voyager plane in a blue Catherine Walker dress as she was met by Shah Mahmoud Qureshi, Pakistan's foreign minister.

Their flight from RAF Brize Norton in Oxfordshire is understood to have been deliberately timed late enough so that they could do the school run before they left.

More than 1,000 Pakistani police will be deployed to watch over the couple in the coming days as they criss-cross the country. Their stay is the first visit to Pakistan by members of the royal family since 2006.

In the coming days the couple will meet both Imran Khan, the prime minister, and the president, Arif Alvi.
description: The Duchess of Cambridge arrived in Pakistan with a nod to both her hosts and the memory of her mother-in-law, wearing a traditional shalwar-kameez style outfit from one of Princess Diana's favourite couture houses.
